meanings.definition: Cause (someone) to feel alienated or estranged.
meanings.sent1: The constant criticism from his boss disaffects him from his job.
meanings.sent2: Being excluded from the group disaffects people and makes them feel lonely.
meanings.sent3: The grumpy cat disaffects the other pets with its unfriendly attitude.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds looming overhead disaffect the cheerful atmosphere of the picnic.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence in the haunted house disaffects visitors, making them uneasy.

meanings.sent1: The betrayal by his best friend disaffects him, causing him to trust others less.
meanings.sent2: Over time, neglect can disaffect even the strongest bond between friends.
meanings.sent3: The spoiled child quickly disaffects his toys by breaking them within days.
meanings.sent4: The constant lies from the politician disaffect the public, eroding their trust.
meanings.sent5: The fading memories of their shared adventures disaffect the old friends, leading them to drift apart.
